recommendations.recommendation:
this is the best ever anime or manga in my life..

must see for a detective lovers...

When deciding to watch this series or not, you have to think about one thing: If you like detective stories. Before I started watching Conan, I`ve never really been into mysteries and such. Now, I got so caught into it and I`m even reading Agatha Christie novels. Watch first three episodes to find out if you have some hidden love for detective series in there. If you won`t like then, you are not going to like it after that. Well anyway, this show`s got a really good, yet very slow, plot. It is getting better after 300+, but it is so slow at the beggining. You can also watch only the story episodes, but that`s your choice. I personally think this show is much better without a fast plot - there is a lot more mysteries to solve. And that`s what detective series are for, aren`t they?

This is The Anime that got me hooked on anime. After 17 years of watching this I am still in love with it`s characters, story, humor & style. Well, it is true that some anime originals can be easily skipped ( I still watch them, sometimes they are funny / interesting, but mostly boring ). The first 30 eps were pure epic, but after that you get lots of fillers in between some really good eps, movies & specials. If this anime was produced in a more condensed format it would have scored much much higher.

In all animes that I saw (350+), this is from far the one that toutches the largest public.
You could be a kid or an adult and like this anime.
There is so much content that you can get lost in all of it.

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch2263 [Kudou Shin`ichi] is a famous 17-year-old high school detective who helps the police solve cases. While investigating a mysterious organization, he was knocked unconscious by one of them, and an experimental poison was forced down his throat. Instead of killing him, however, the drug shrunk him into a little kid. In order to prevent the men in black who did this to him from hurting his friends and family, he changed his name to http://anidb.net/ch2260 [Edogawa Conan] and took on the identity of a gifted primary school student who solves mysteries and crimes through reasoning, logic, the help of his friends and some nifty gadgets Dr. http://anidb.net/ch8164 [Agasa Hiroshi] invented for him. Now, he lives with his childhood friend, http://anidb.net/ch2343 [Mouri Ran], and her father, detective http://anidb.net/ch8163 [Mouri Kogorou], without them knowing about his situation, and carries on his investigation of the organization that is still out to kill him.

tag.name: baseball
tag.description: Baseball is like a complicated version of Rounders. It involves hitting a ball with a stick, then running around several bases placed in the form of a diamond on a field. Big in the US, and also in Japan.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: elementary school
tag.description: The term elementary school is used in some countries for schools where children from the age of about five receive primary education.

tag.name: horny nosebleed
tag.description: In Japanese media, healthy young men who have no other sexual outlet will often suffer nosebleeds upon seeing the naked female body, or even just a pair of well-filled panties. The nosebleed is, of course, a visual shorthand/euphemism for sexual arousal. It is commonly interpreted that way for males and females, with little trickles of blood indicating mild arousal, and gushing fountains of blood indicating erection/extreme arousal in both sexes. It can also be interpreted as shorthand strictly for erections in males. In that case, when blood shoots from the nose explosively, and in ridiculous quantity, the implication would be an ejaculation. Source: TVTrope

tag.name: precocious
tag.description: Exhibiting mature qualities at an unusually early age, especially in mental aptitude.

tag.name: bad cooking
tag.description: The character is hopelessly terrible at cooking, and any attempts he or she makes at making even the simplest dishes are spectacular failures.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: prodigy
tag.description: Character is very good at everything he/she does.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: gunfights
tag.description: Fights where two or more parties are firing guns at one another.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Osaka
tag.description: Osaka Prefecture is a prefecture located in the Kansai region on Honshu, the main island of Japan. The capital is the city of Osaka. It is the center of Osaka-Kobe-Kyoto area. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Okinawa
tag.description: Okinawa Prefecture is the southernmost prefecture of Japan. It encompasses two thirds of the Ryukyu Islands in a chain over 1,000 kilometreslong. The Ryukyu Islands extend southwest from Kyushu (the southwesternmost of Japan`s four main islands) to Taiwan. Naha, Okinawa`s capital, is located in the southern part of Okinawa Island. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: New York
tag.description: The City of New York, often called New York City or simply New York, is the most populous city in the United States. New York City is also the most densely populated major city in the United States. Located at the southern tip of the state of New York, the city is the center of the New York metropolitan area, one of the most populous urban agglomerations in the world. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: London
tag.description: London is the capital and most populous city of both England and the United Kingdom. Standing on the River Thames in the south east of the island of Great Britain, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. It was founded by the Romans, who named it Londinium. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: United Kingdom
tag.description: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, commonly known as the United Kingdom (UK) or Britain, is a sovereign country in western Europe. Lying off the north-western coast of the European mainland, the UK includes the island of Great Britain, the north-eastern part of the island of Ireland and many smaller islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: United States
tag.description: The United States of America (commonly referred to as the United States, the U.S., the USA, or America) is a federal constitutional republic comprising fifty states and a federal district. The country is situated mostly in central North America, where its forty-eight contiguous states and Washington, D.C., the capital district, lie between the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans, bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south. The state of Alaska is in the north-west of the continent, with Canada to the east and Russia to the west across the Bering Strait. The state of Hawaii is an archipelago in the mid-Pacific. The country also possesses several territories in the Caribbean and Pacific. Source: wiki

tag.name: Europe
tag.description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. It comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Americas
tag.description: The Americas, also collectively called America, encompass the totality of the continents of North America and South America. Together they make up most of Earth`s western hemisphere and comprise the New World. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: thriller
tag.description: The thriller is a genre of fiction in which tough, resourceful, but essentially ordinary heroes are pitted against villains determined to destroy them, their country, or the stability of the free world. The hero of a typical thriller faces danger alone or in the company of a small band of companions. The protagonist may be a law enforcement agent, a journalist, or a soldier, but typically he or she is cut off from the resources of "their" organization. More often the hero is an ordinary citizen drawn into danger and intrigue by circumstances beyond their control. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: law and order
tag.description: Where there is "wealth", there are criminals. It is up to the civil law enforcement, i.e. detectives, Police or Special Squads, to keep the lawless activities in the real world or in cyberspace under control. Note: Do not confuse this with Military presence.

tag.name: police
tag.description: The police (civil servants) are the good guys in the battle against crime. Though they try hard, they are usually outclassed by super-criminals or criminal organizations in anime, requiring the help of special units or some lone hero.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: skilled main character
tag.description: The main character in the show is very skilled in one or more tasks, often to the amazement of those around him/her.

tag.name: real-world location
tag.description: Places seen in the show exist in reality. Note: This could be sometime in the future, though names and certain places will still be recognizable.

tag.name: Tokyo Skytree
tag.description: Tokyo Skytree is a broadcasting, restaurant, and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo, Japan. It became the tallest structure in Japan in 2010 and reached its full height of 634.0 metres in March 2011, making it the tallest tower in the world, displacing the Canton Tower, and the second tallest structure in the world after Burj Khalifa (829.8 m). Source: Wikipedia Note: Not to be confused with the very much older http://anidb.net/t3667 [Tokyo Tower].

tag.name: wordplay
tag.description: The characters play with words. E.g. purposely or accidentally use similar-sounding but wrongly applied words in the Japanese original, leading to supposedly funny misunderstandings and confusion.

tag.name: car chases
tag.description: Car chases occur as part of the action setting in this anime.

tag.name: time doesn`t pass
tag.description: You know those series where the characters are the same old selves after years, never aging, never changing, still doing what they do best? Well, you`re in one of them right now!

tag.name: Tokyo Tower
tag.description: Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan. At 332.9 metres, it is the second-tallest structure in Japan. The structure is an Eiffel Tower-inspired lattice tower that is painted white and international orange to comply with air safety regulations. Source: Wikipedia Note: Not to be confused with the very much younger http://anidb.net/t3037 [Tokyo Skytree].

tag.name: trapped in the body of a child
tag.description: For some reason, a character in this anime who is a late-teenager or an adult, has their mind trapped in the body of a child. E.g. a former late teenager or an adult is transformed into a child. This can be the result of magic, science, or otherwise.

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: police are useless
tag.description: The civilian law enforcement representatives do not seem to be of much use, when trying to take on the usually vastly superior foes. The "helpless" and often clumsy antics of the police can be used as a comedy element.

tag.name: widescreen transition
tag.description: When it began, this anime was made in 4:3 (fullscreen), but over the course of its run, the decision was made to change the production to 16:9 (widescreen) instead. Typically found with 100+ episode series that began in the mid-00s or before. Not to be confused with "broadcast cropped to 4-3" or "delayed 16-9 broadcast"

tag.name: adapted into JDrama
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a JDrama. A JDrama (Japanese drama), also called "terebi dorama" ("television drama") or "dorama" for short, is a Japanese live action television series. Japan produces many drama series every year, from a huge variety of genres. Like anime, they generally air in three-month seasons or multiples thereof, with new shows airing every season. Some kinds of drama, especially the morning or afternoon ones, tend to be broadcast daily, while evening ones tend to be broadcast weekly, also like anime. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: Sherlock Holmes
tag.description: Fictional London-based detective created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

tag.name: Hiroshima
tag.description: Hiroshima Prefecture is a prefecture of Japan located in the Chuugoku region on Honshu island. The capital is the city of Hiroshima. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: adults are useless
tag.description: For when adults can`t do anything right.

tag.name: secret organisation
tag.description: A secret organisation or secret society is an organisation whose activities and inner functioning are concealed from non-members. The society may or may not attempt to conceal its existence itself. Examples of historical and existing secret societies include Freemasonry, the Knights Templar, the Rosicrucians, Skull and Bones, the Thule Society, and the Illuminati.

tag.name: family without mother
tag.description: For some reason, the protagonist`s mother is no longer among the living. The much-too-early death was due to sickness or accident. This plot device adds a certain degree of tragedy to the anime, and usually has repercussions on the rest of the family. For example: the grief-stricken father and children barely function as humans; the oldest daughter has an extra burden of raising the other children, additional emphasis is given to the only female child in the family, i.e. with bishounen brother and dad in a shoujo setting. In rare cases the mother may still be alive, just not living with the rest of the family presently, i.e. on some quest or job and gone for a long time.

tag.name: secret identity
tag.description: The (usually main) protagonist has a secret identity that he or she desperately tries to keep secret. This can lead to all sorts of amusing misunderstandings, thus is used as comedy element in some anime.

tag.name: battle of wits
tag.description: There is some intellectual battle between the characters. They each might attempt to discern what the other knows and/or could be planning. Then, rather than simply relying on the use of raw power, try to deduce an effective strategy to foil their opponent(s). The battle of wits can be in the center of the intrigue or just a side story. Examples: Death Note, Code Geass

tag.name: perpetual ongoing
tag.description: No end in sight! No matter what the genre may be or what the storyline consists of, this series just keeps on going... and on... and on. The obvious downside to this is the lack of story-related focus, usually some vague goal is simply never reached. This lack of conclusion can tend to annoy, making the whole series pretty much pointless. Examples: One Piece, Naruto, Bleach, Detective Conan, Dragon Ball (Z), or Pocket Monsters (Pokemon).

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: character related tags which need deleting or merging
tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: episodic
tag.description: An episodic anime consists of many successive short arcs that are generally 1-2 episodes in length, with strong plot continuity within each arc but generally little continuity from one arc to the next. For long shows (well upwards of 50 episodes), the episode count constraint is less tight; for example, a show with close to 250 episodes would also be considered episodic if it consisted of a majority of arcs of up to 3 or maybe 4 episodes and possibly also very few slightly longer arcs.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Sunday
tag.description: Weekly Shounen Sunday is a weekly shounen manga magazine published in Japan by Shogakukan since 1959. Contrary to its title, Weekly Shounen Sunday issues are released on Wednesdays. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: courtroom drama
tag.description: A courtroom drama uses the proceedings of a trial, court case, or other legal proceedings as the main element of the plot. The story generally takes place in a court of law, and the key characters are the defendant, the lawyers for prosecution and defence, judge, and jurors, and witnesses. There may be significant action outside the courtroom as the defence and prosecution chase witnesses or gather evidence.

tag.name: kabuki
tag.description: Kabuki is a classical Japanese dance-drama. Kabuki theatre is known for the stylization of its drama and for the elaborate make-up worn by some of its performers. It is a form of "avant-garde" or "bizarre" theatre. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Mouri Ran
character.description: Mouri Ran is one of the main characters in Detective Conan. She is the daughter of Mouri Kogoro, a famous but lazy detective. She is also friends with Kudo Shinichi, another famous detective, who is still in high school. She is the captain of the high school karate team, and is very strong willed.

character.name: Inuyasha
character.description: InuYasha is a hanyou (half-demon), the product of an inu-youkai (犬妖怪, dog demon) and a human. He wields Tetsusaiga, a supernatural sword made from one of his deceased father`s fangs. When properly wielded, the sword can destroy one hundred demons with a single swing. InuYasha can quickly recover from injuries that would be fatal to a human, largely due to his demonic blood. During the first night of each lunar month (new moon), InuYasha changes into a normal human with black hair and black eyes and loses his demonic powers. InuYasha was bound to Goshinboku by Kikyo`s arrow for fifty years until Kagome freed him. InuYasha wears a special bead necklace that forces him to respond to Kagome`s command "Osuwari!", which translates to "Sit!" in English. In the English-dubbed version, "InuYasha, sit!" or "Sit, boy!" are sometimes used instead. Following the command, InuYasha is thrown to the ground. Kaede had placed the necklace upon InuYasha because he had threatened to kill Kagome if she refused to give the Jewel of Four Souls to him. As the series goes on, he begins to like Kagome more and more, shown when he will leave a battle to save her from being hurt.

character.name: Mouri Kogorou
character.description: Kogorou was once with the police, but due to an incident that involved his wife Eri as well, he quit. Due to the same incident, he and Eri split up. He`s got custody of his daughter Ran who lives with him in an apartment that is at the same time his detective agency, on top of a café named Coffee Poirot. Despite of having been a good policeman, he`s a bad detective - but still very famous. That only comes due to the fact that Conan is "abusing" this adult`s sedated body to deduct his theories for the sake of outing the high amount of murderers whose crimes he solved. Kogorou might be a smoking, drinking, good-for-nothing loudmouth with a high affection to idol Okino Youko, but he still is a good guy when it comes to handling his daughter or wife. Due to Conan having made him famous as the Sleeping Kogorou, he sometimes gets over his head and just believes he`s the big shot everybody else thinks he is. Kogorou finally accepts Conan as a "lodger", when Conan`s "mother" gave him access to an account filled with 10.000.000 Yen (about 90.000€/122.500$). His voice is Number 59 on Conan`s bowtie.

character.name: Agasa Hiroshi
character.description: Agasa Hiroshi is a good friend of Shin`ichi / Conan who invents several devices to help him out, such as the voice changing bowtie or the watch with which Conan can tranquilize people. Note: His name Hiroshi is written with the kanji 博士, which can also be read `Hakase` (Professor)

character.name: Suzuki Sonoko
character.description: Sonoko is Mouri Ran`s best friend and is the girlfriend of http://anidb.net/ch8180 [Kyougoku Makoto]. Source: detectiveconanworld.com

character.name: Kisaki Eri
character.description: Kisaki Eri is Ran`s mother and the ex-wife of her childhood-friend Kogorou. She`s also a famous lawyer. Even though they`re divorced, Eri is still wearing her wedding ring. When asked by Ran about that, she answers that it keeps "other dirty men" away. Ran hopes that her parents will find back together.

character.name: Tooyama Kazuha
character.description: Kazuha is a girl from Osaka. She`s been childhood friends with Heiji, and could be referred to as his girlfriend - even though they`re too shy / childish to admit it already. When she meets Ran for the first time (episode 118) she directly explains to her that Heiji is off limits, and that the girl/woman that wants to get to him has to go through her fast - which makes her either protective or possessive of Heiji. Later on Ran and Kazuha become really good girl friends. Kazuha`s father, like Heiji`s, also works for the Osaka police.

character.name: Hattori Shizuka
character.description: Hattori Shizuka is http://anidb.net/ch8178 [Hattori Heiji]`s mother, a fact that shocks http://anidb.net/ch8163 [Kogoro], http://anidb.net/ch2343 [Ran], and http://anidb.net/ch2260 [Conan], due to her incredibly youthful appearance. Heiji is the only one who insults her looks, calling her "old lady." Nonetheless, Shizuka is very supportive of her son, rooting for him to solve cases, though she sometimes calls her husband, http://anidb.net/ch8192 [Hattori Heizo], police chief of Osaka, to assist Heiji.

character.name: Hakuba Saguru
character.description: Hakuba Saguru is another teenage detective, just like http://anidb.net/ch2263 [Kudou Shin`ichi] and http://anidb.net/ch8178 [Hattori Heiji]. However, he does a lot of his work in England, as well as Japan, and has maybe even handled more cases than Shin`ichi and Heiji.

character.name: Kyougoku Makoto
character.description: Haido High School karate club captain, Kyougoku Makoto, "The Prince of Attack", who saves Suzuki Sonoko`s life in part two of "Sonoko`s Dangerous Summer Story", episodes 153-154.

character.name: Takagi Wataru
character.description: Takagi Wataru (named after his voice actor who ad-lipped his own name in a scene) is a police officer from the Investigation Division (1st Division).

character.name: Megure Juuzou
character.description: Inspector Juuzou is a veteran police officer who has been working with http://anidb.net/ch2263 [Kudou Shin`ichi], http://anidb.net/ch8175 [Kudou Yuusaku] and http://anidb.net/ch8163 [Mouri Kogoro]. He always wears his hat to hide an old scar which reminds him of a special case from 20 years ago, during his early police days which involved his wife, http://anidb.net/ch16583 [Midori].

character.name: Nakamori Ginzou
character.description: Inspector of the Police Headquarter`s Criminal Investigation Squad 2.

character.name: Tooyama Ginshirou
character.description: Tooyama Ginshirou is the Head of the Oosaka Police Department.

character.name: Jodie Starling
character.description: Jodie Starling was introduced as http://anidb.net/ch2343 [Mouri Ran]`s English teacher under the name of http://anidb.net/ch8975 [Jodie Saintemillion]. She is later revealed to be an FBI agent with a personal vendetta against http://anidb.net/ch8206 [Vermouth] who murdered her father. She knows of http://anidb.net/ch2260 [Edogawa Conan]`s detective skills and often has him help the FBI to battle the Black Organization.

character.name: Akai Shuuichi
character.description: Akai is a FBI agent who`s working with Jodie Starling and James Black. His identity in Black Organization is Moboroshi Dai. [spoiler="Spoiler"]His girlfriend is Miyano Akemi, Shiho`s older sister. He had a personal vendetta with Black Organization because her death. After his fake dead by Kir. Akai change is disguise to Okiya Subaru and live in Shin`ichi house.[/spoiler]

character.name: Yokomizo Sango
character.description: A detective that started off in the Saitama Prefectural Police Squad. After time he was transferred to the Shizuoka Prefectural Police, thus crossing ways with Conan more often.

character.name: Gin
character.description: Gin is a high-ranking official in the Black Organization and the primary antagonist of the series. He is the organization member who gave http://anidb.net/ch2263 [Kudou Shin`ichi] the experimental poison APTX 4869 which turned him into http://anidb.net/ch2260 [Edogawa Conan]. He is frequently paired on missions with http://anidb.net/ch8204 [Vodka].

character.name: Kuro no Soshiki
character.description: Kuro no Soshiki, or The Black Syndicate is the organization behind Shin`ichi`s shrinking.

character.name: Oosaka Fukei
character.description: The Osaka Prefectural Police.

character.name: Uehara Yui
character.description: married into the Torada family

character.name: Chaki Shintarou
character.description: Superintendent of the Police Headquarters Criminal Investigation Squad 2. And quite choleric.

character.name: Suzuki Shirou
character.description: Chairman of the Suzuki Corporation.

character.name: Kobayashi Sumiko
character.description: Teacher of class 1B (Conan`s class) in Teitan Elementary School.

character.name: Miyano Akemi
character.description: Big sister of http://anidb.net/ch8166 [Miyano Shiho] aka http://anidb.net/ch8165 [Haibara Ai]. Both of them work(ed) for the http://anidb.net/ch8215 [Kuro no Soshiki]. Akemi uses the alias of Hirota Masami when she is forced to take on a job in a bank in order for the organisation to rob it later. After Conan revealed his real identity to her, she gives him the first big clues about his condition. She dies moments later.

character.name: Lum
character.description: Lum (also referred to in some Western versions as Lamu - since her name in Japanese is technically pronounced "Ramu") is the second main protagonist of the series. She is a beautiful Oni alien who is capable of flying and generating electrical shocks and even lightning. She is extremely popular and is famous for ending her sentences with ~daccha (loosely translated as "yes?" or "you know?"). Except when in her school girl`s uniform, she usually wears a sexy outfit consisting of a tiger-striped bikini and knee-high go-go boots. While generally good-natured, sweet, faithful, and innocent, Lum also has a very hot temper and she is extremely jealous. Her dream in life is to live in a "Sweet Home with Darling" in which she keeps house and raises babies while Ataru, her "Darling," works a job. Unfortunately, Lum`s idea of "cooking" is to take very spicy ingredients like jalapenos, cayenne peppers and Tabasco sauce and irradiate them with an alien energy bazooka until they carbonize into inedible, crystallized nuggets. As an alien she has access to many bizarre gadgets whose use she really doesn`t understand all that well, leading to comic results. Differences between human and "Invader" physiology also drive many stories, like the time Lum`s horns begin to grow larger after she is bitten by a cow, or the time she becomes drunk by eating pickled plums. (Source: Wikipedia.com)

character.name: Ano Kata
character.description: S/he is the leader of the Black Organisation. The name is a mere designation and means something like `that person` (the 方 - kata) makes it formal).

character.name: Kuriyama Midori
character.description: She`s Kisaki Eri`s Secretary.

character.name: Suzuki Tomoko
character.description: Sonoko`s mother.

character.name: Suzuki Ayako
character.description: Sonoko`s older sister.

character.name: Koizumi Akako
character.description: Koizumi Akako is actually a witch with real magic, which causes her to be very critical of Kaitou`s "sleight-of-hand" magic. She knows that he is Kid, but has not told anyone. Akako is very much a seductress, and is "trying to make every man her slave". She is at first angry at Kaitou because she cannot "control" him, but later on she grows to love him. She seems to be able to summon Lucifer at will. She appeared in episode 219 and the first OVA of Detective Conan. Her attitude is like Haibara Ai of Detective Conan. She originally belongs to Magic Kaitou (まじっく快斗), a manga series by http://anidb.net/cr474 [Aoyama Goushou], the creator of Meitantei Conan.

character.name: Okino Youko
character.description: Young pop star idol who is a regular focus of worship by Mouri Kogoro. She has a number of cameos throughout the series, mostly as a prominent guest at some social gatherings which turn into criminal cases. -From wikipedia

character.name: Megure Midori
character.description: When Midori was about 18 years old, a serial hit-and-runner was stalking the streets, randomly targeting high school girls wearing long skirts, due to harrassment by a girl gang he had suffered under (the girls had been wearing long skirts as well). When Midori`s best friend ended up the first fatality, she decided to help apprehend the killer and volunteered to act as a decoy. She was teamed up with http://anidb.net/ch8183 [Megure Juuzo], then still a junior police officer. Unfortunately, the car runner surprised and hit them both. But Megure was able to remember the car`s license number, and the perpetrator was soon arrested. Midori was gravely injured in the accident, but recovered with only a scar on her forehead to show for her ordeal, and some time afterwards she married Megure out of gratitude. In a strange switch of role, she is perhaps the only person who has managed to temper his impulsive surges, a role her husband feels a bit bashful about. Midori has also appeared, in an unseen role, as a witness to a crime and had to be taken to the station for questioning, as well as making a cameo appearance during the White Day Murder Case.

character.name: Jii Kounosuke
character.description: Jii Kounosuke is http://anidb.net/ch8218 [Kuroba Kaitou]`s assistant.

character.name: Katsuhiko no Haha
character.description: Katsuhiko`s Mother.

character.name: Asai Narumi
character.description: A nurse working on the island of Tsukishima that originally came from Tokyo.

character.name: Murasawa Shuuichi
character.description: Fiancé to the daugter of the mayor, Reiko.

character.name: Kawashima Hideo
character.description: The wealthiest man in town.

character.name: Kuroiwa Reiko
character.description: The mayors only daughter.

character.name: Hirata Kazuaki
character.description: The private secretary of the mayor of Tsukikage Island.

character.name: Shimizu Masato
character.description: A candidate for mayor on Tsukikage Island.

character.name: Kuroiwa Tatsuji
character.description: The mayor of Tsukikage Island.

character.name: Keikan
character.description: A Keikan (english: Policeman) on Tsukikage Island.

character.name: Kujou Reiko
character.description: Kujou Reiko is a public prosecutor, nicknamed "Madonna of the Courtroom" and is http://anidb.net/ch8172 [Kisaki Eri]`s rival.

character.name: Itou Tamanosuke
character.description: Leader of a troupe of performance artists.

character.name: Hiroki
character.description: Hiroki is a pupil from the same school the kids go to, but from another class. He`s asking the detective boys to find his cat, Akira.

character.name: Keibiin
character.description: The department store guard.

character.name: Kazumi
character.description: A friend of Sayuri`s that`s helping her out at the wedding.

character.name: Matsumoto Sayuri
character.description: A junior high school homeroom music teacher that works at the school Ran and Shin`ichi attended. She always scolded Shin`ichi for his tone deafness, which he calls `terrorizing`. Sayuri has a weakness for lemon tea. She`s also the daughter of http://anidb.net/ch8188 [Matsumoto Kiyonaga].

character.name: Umemiya
character.description: He`s a year older than Sonoko and Ran and seems to admire his teacher Matsumoto Sayuri.

character.name: Toshihiko
character.description: Sayuri`s groom and the heir of the Takasugi Group. According to Sonoko, he`s indecisive and unrealiable and that it`s said, that the Takasugi Group will break apart when he`s going to be the president. Sayuri still seems to love him dearly.

character.name: Taniguchi Mika
character.description: The secretary of http://anidb.net/ch27659 [Ashiya-sensei].

character.name: Akio no Chichi
character.description: Akio`s Father.

character.name: Akio no Haha
character.description: Akio`s Mother.

character.name: Yuujin
character.description: A nameless friend Kogorou meets up with for drinking.

character.name: Shimamura Sachiko
character.description: She`s an Import Sales Director and known to Kogorou through meeting her in the café under his Agency, Coffee Poirot.

character.name: Tsukumo Nanae
character.description: A woman who has been sent to the Detective Agency by Kisaki Eri.

character.name: Sanada Kazumi
character.description: Magician Motoyasu`s most likely successor, the ace under the three apprentices.

character.name: Miyoshi Mako
character.description: An apprentice of Motoyasu. She`s said to act tough but has exceptional skills when it comes to magic.

character.name: Momochi Yuuji
character.description: An apprentice of Motoyasu. He`s not as skilled as the other two, but shows potential.

character.name: Tsukumo Ayano
character.description: The daughter of Tsukumo Motoyasu. She`s also in the same school as Conan, in class A.

character.name: Yabuuchi Hiromi
character.description: A classmate and childhood friend of Kudou Yukiko`s.

character.name: Yabuuchi Yoshifusa
character.description: Hiromi`s uncle who spent a while in Brazil.

character.name: Carlos
character.description: A friend of Yabuuchi Yoshifusa and his bodyguard... ...or rather, he`s introduced as his bodyguard, but actually, it`s the other way around. Carlos is the child of the real Yoshifusa and a brazilian woman, who needs to be protected.

character.name: Yabuuchi Yoshiyuki
character.description: Hiromi`s younger brother.

character.name: Yabuuchi Keiko
character.description: Yoshiyuki`s wife.

character.name: Yabuuchi Hidekazu
character.description: Hiromi`s Husband.

character.name: Yabuuchi Machiko
character.description: Second Wife to Yoshichika.

character.name: Bengoshi
character.description: The nameless family lawyer of the Yabuuchi.

character.name: Hickson Tanaka
character.description: The real identity of the first thought to be Yabuuchi Yoshifusa is this 2nd generation Japanese-Brazilian man, who has been friends with the real Yoshifusa. He`s escorting Carlos to Japan for the sake of him getting his rightful inheritance.

character.name: Imamura Toshiaki
character.description: The Ichikawa Family`s Butler.

character.name: Ichikawa Koutarou
character.description: The C.E.O. of Ichikawa Sangyou (Ichikawa Industries).

character.name: Okano Hitoshi
character.description: Koutarou`s Doctor.

character.name: Ichikawa Kazue
character.description: The eldest daughter of the Ichikawa Family.

character.name: Ichikawa Mizue
character.description: The 2nd daughter of the Ichikawa family.

character.name: Tsuchiya Masuko
character.description: Potter Kikuemon`s daughter-in-law, who`s taking care of him all by herself.

character.name: Kikuemon
character.description: Kikuemon, or Tsuchiya Mankichi (土屋万吉), is a famous potter.

character.name: Ootani Kaoru
character.description: Kikuemon`s apprentice.

character.name: Seto Ryuuichi
character.description: Kikuemon`s apprentice.

character.name: Arita Yoshihiko
character.description: Kikuemon`s apprentice.

character.name: Kanshiki
character.description: The CSI guy.

character.name: Uchida Asami
character.description: She`s from Touto University, Literature Major and is a Freshman. It`s believed that she was Shin`ichi`s first love.

character.name: Sawai Manabu
character.description: He`s from Touto Unuversity, is a Literature Major and the President of the Mystery Research Club.

character.name: Hayasaka Tomoko
character.description: She`s from Touto University, Literature Major and is the Vice-President of the Mystery Research Club.

character.name: Miyazaki Chika
character.description: She`s from Touto University, Literature Major.

character.name: Morimoto Yoshinobu
character.description: He`s from Touto University, Literature Major.

character.name: Noguchi Shibahisa
character.description: He`s from Touto University, Literature Major.

character.name: Shoubou Taiin
character.description: Shoubou Taiin literally means firefighter. He`s one of the firefighters that try to extinguish the fire in the house. Note: He`s credited in episode 100 as 消防隊員, and in episode 101 as 消防隊員A.

character.name: Konbini-tenchou
character.description: The manager of the Convenience Store

character.name: Okita Hajime
character.description: Another famous actor.

character.name: Hijikata Kouzaburou
character.description: A famous actor from samurai movies.

character.name: Nagakura Isami
character.description: As the wife of Hijikata Kouzaburou, she`s actually named Hijikata Isami. She`s also a former actress.

character.name: Touzoku Dan Ani
character.description: The older brother of the two.

character.name: Nakamura Misao
character.description: A mystery writer that inherited a big house full with riddles.

character.name: Nakai Atsushi
character.description: He`s a newspaper reporter.

character.name: Untenshu
character.description: The taxi driver that brings Conan to the crime scene.

character.name: Shikaisha
character.description: Shikaisha is not a name, but describes the position of moderator and means the man that lead through the awards.

character.name: Yanase Ryuuichi
character.description: An awarded photograph, that got to his fame with not-so-normal means.

character.name: Director
character.description: The director of the TV Show both Mouri Kogorou and Yanase Ryuuichi appear on.

character.name: Inoue Waka
character.description: Anime appearance of the idol and actress http://anidb.net/cr23554 [Inoue Waka].

character.name: Yamamoto Azusa
character.description: Anime appearance of model and talent http://anidb.net/cr23555 [Yamamoto Azusa].

character.name: Kondou Taketoshi
character.description: Kondou Taketoshi is the director of the movie that`s being produced during the case.

character.name: Nachi Shingo
character.description: He`s a romance actor that also worked with Kogorou`s favourite actress/songstress Okino Youko. He`s quite flirty and likes matchstick puzzles.

character.name: Mamegaki Taeko
character.description: She`s a scriptwriter.

character.name: Anzai Morio
character.description: Stage hand with a funky watch.

character.name: Mamegaki Kyuusaku
character.description: The grandfather of scriptwriter Mamegaki Taeko. He`s also the caretaker of the shrine they film the movie at.

character.name: Shimazaki Yuuji
character.description: The assistant director of the movie, and fiancée to screenwriter Mamegaki Taeko.

character.name: Nakai no Obasan
character.description: The waitress at the inn.

character.name: Hatamoto Kitarou
character.description: Husband to Mariko and the adopted son-in-law of the Hatamoto family.

character.name: Hatamoto Takeshi
character.description: He`s the groom of Hatamoto Natsue.

character.name: Hatamoto Mariko
character.description: Wife to Kitarou and oldest daughter of the Hatamoto family, mother of Ichirou.

character.name: Hatamoto Natsue
character.description: She`s the 2nd daughter of Shoichi and married to Hatamoto Takeshi. The granddaughter of Hatamoto Gozou.

character.name: Hatamoto Tatsuo
character.description: Akie`s husband and the adopted son-in-law of the Hatamoto family.

character.name: Hatamoto Akie
character.description: Natsue`s older sister, daughter of the late Shoichi.

character.name: Hatamoto Jouji
character.description: He`s the second son of the Hatamoto family. Later on he becomes chef in a french restaurant.

character.name: Hatamoto Ichirou
character.description: The only son of Hatamoto Kitarou. He likes to draw, which is seen as a waste of time by his grandfather. His mother thinks he has a great amount of talent.

character.name: Hatamoto Gozou
character.description: The present head of the Hatamoto family. He doesn`t like it when decisions are made without his approval - or he likes to scream at people in general.

character.name: Suzuki Kenji
character.description: The Hatamoto family butler.

character.name: Ishi
character.description: "Ishi" literally means doctor.

character.name: Maya
character.description: Maya is the only name the woman that falls onto Kogorou and the kids on a public street remembers.

character.name: Doorman
character.description: The doorman from the hotel Maya stayed at.

character.name: Keikan
character.description: Another policeman.

character.name: Hanai Akiko
character.description: Secretary.

character.name: Senchou
character.description: Senchou is referring to the captain of the ship Conan (and Ran) are asking for clues.

character.name: Takei Katsuhiko
character.description: Father of the kidnapped Naoko.

character.name: Takei Naoko
character.description: The victim of the kidnapping.

character.name: John
character.description: Takeshi`s dog.

character.name: Sakaguchi
character.description: The owner of John.

character.name: Sugita Sanae
character.description: Takeshi`s girlfriend.

character.name: Sensei
character.description: Conan`s swimming teacher.

character.name: Horikoshi Yumi
character.description: She`s a cosmetics company employee and also an old friend of Kogorou`s whom she knows from the Judo Club they were both in.

character.name: Keikan
character.description: Yet another policeman from Beika.

character.name: Ayashiro Yukio
character.description: He`s a high school gym teacher and also an old friend of Kogorou`s whom he knows from the Judo Club they were both in.

character.name: Oomura Jun
character.description: He`s a model shop manager and also an old friend of Kogorou`s whom he knows from the Judo Club they were both in. Later, Oomura is also the manager of a Plastic Model Shop.

character.name: Ayashiro Noriko
character.description: She`s a housewife and also an old friend of Kogorou`s whom she knows from the Judo Club they were both in. Her maiden name is Kimoto Noriko. She`s married to Ayashiro Yukio. She says that she was the idol of the Judo club.

character.name: Nakamichi Kazushi
character.description: He`s a Prefectural Police Officer from Chiba and also an old friend of Kogorou`s whom he knows from the Judo Club they were both in.

character.name: Nakai
character.description: Nakai refers to a waitress at the inn.

character.name: Driver
character.description: A man whose car unfortunately almost kills Hiroshi.

character.name: Ten`in
character.description: A woman that works in a shop as a salesperson.

character.description: A man that works at a liquor store (Saka-ya no Ten`in). He`s helping Hiroshi on the way by taking him a bit on his bicycle.

character.description: After losing his wife and kid caused by bancruptcy, he became a very unfriendly fellow.

character.name: Koda Kaoru

As Ran points out, he had been the national karate champion "six years ago". It was because of her admiration for him that she took up the sport.

When the police corner Phantom Thief on the top of a building, it looks like his amazing career is over until he uses a flash bomb to blind his would be captors and make a harrowing escape. All that remains of the Phantom is a note announcing his next move: to steal the Black Star during an anniversary party on board the Queen Isabelle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.summary: Conan, Kogoro, and Ran In Purple Toyota Crown GRS204 Drive pass through Mount Fuyana on their way home and are stopped by Misao Yamamura who instilled a road block in order to catch the Silver Witch, a woman who drives a White FD car and challenges people in a drag race. When the witch drifts, the tire makes a sound that sound like a woman screaming. Yamamura reveals his grandma raced against the witch but gave up when the witch drove into the air. Kogoro decides to investigate on the identity of the witch and returns to Mount Fuyana the next day, taking Conan and Ran with him in Orange Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution X (CZ4A). Upon meeting the witch, Kogoro has a drag race with her but stops when Conan reveals that the witch drove into a road less area. Kogoro tells Yamamura to stop all White FD drivers and wait for his arrival. Once there, Kogoro interrogates the three suspect pairs in order to find out which one of them is the witch.

Umi ni Uragirareta Otoko
赤い女の惨劇 (復讐)
Tragedy of the Red Woman (Revenge)
Akai Onna no Sangeki (Fukushuu)
episode.summary: Sumika is attacked by someone resembling the Red Woman, but the cut is shallow, and Uehara treats her with antiseptic. Uehara explains there was no mistake in the DNA test of the Red Woman. However, Uehera adds since over ten years ago around this time of year, rental villas in the area are robbed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 赤い女の惨劇 (悪霊)
Tragedy of the Red Woman (Evil Spirit)
Akai Onna no Sangeki (Akuryou)
episode.summary: Hakuya`s body is discovered, and the Nagano police led by Uehara Yoshie begin their investigation. Uehara believes the culprit struck Hakuya on the back of the head with a blunt object and knocked him unconscious before drowning him in the bathtub. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 赤い女の惨劇 (湯煙)
Tragedy of the Red Woman (Steam)
Akai Onna no Sangeki (Yukemuri)
episode.summary: Sera heads to the rental villa to meet a client with Conan, Ran, and Sonoko. On their way, Ran and Sonoko spot a woman dressed in red from head to toe. At the rental villa, Tamami, Sumika, Ninda, and Hakuya, members of a former high school outdoor club, had gathered. 15 years prior, a wife stabbed her husband to death at a nearby villa. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シェアハウスの死角
The Blind Spot in the Share House
Share House no Shikaku
意外な結果の恋愛小説 (後編)
The Romance Novel with the Unexpected Conclusion (Part 2)
Igai na Kekka no Ren`ai Shousetsu (Kouhen)
episode.summary: Author Keigo Hiura`s assistant Chiaki Minazuki is found strangled to death in a hotel. Hiura has a perfect alibi, but Conan and Sera are certain he committed the crime. They ask about the condition of Minazuki`s room and get closer to the truth. A 20 year old postcard is discovered inside Minazuki`s suitcase. It is addressed to Hiura, and the sender is not Minazuki but Jun Ota, which is also the name of the heroine in Hiura`s "The Phone, the Ocean, and I". Later a casual remark from Takagi helps Conan and Sera realize how Hiura manipulated his alibi... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 意外な結果の恋愛小説 (前編)
The Romance Novel with the Unexpected Conclusion (Part 1)
Igai na Kekka no Ren`ai Shousetsu (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Conan, Ran, and Sonoko visit the hotel room where Sera is living. In the hallway on the 30th floor of Sera`s hotel, editors A, B, and C wait for author Hiura Keigo to finish his manuscripts. Later, Hiura`s assistant Minazuki Chiori is found murdered in the room directly below Hiura`s. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 自首したお笑い芸人 (後編)
The Comedian Who Turned Himself In (Part 2)
Jishu Shita Owaraigeinin (Kouhen)
episode.summary: Conan feels something is wrong with DoDonPa`s all too convenient alibi and begins to strongly suspect him. After taking on the guilt for a murder he didn`t commit, DoDonPa becomes the man of the hour for trying to protect the reputation of his benefactor Tendo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 自首したお笑い芸人 (前編)
The Comedian Who Turned Himself In (Part 1)
Jishu Shita Owaraigeinin (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Comedian DoDonPa Rokusuke turns himself in at a police box for the murder of his talent agency`s president Tendo Hideki. True to his testimony, Tendo is discovered at the agency dead from a blow to the head, and DoDonPa claims he struck the president with the metal bat found beside the body. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コナンと平次 恋の暗号 (後編)
Conan and Heiji`s Code of Love (Part 2)
Conan et Heiji, le code de l`amour (2e partie)
Conan to Heiji: Koi no Angou (Kouhen)
episode.summary: When Heiji arrives at Nihonbashi, the scene of the drug deal, he finds three people wearing or holding white roses. Heiji trasmits images of the three people to Conan using his cell phone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コナンと平次 恋の暗号 (前編)
Conan and Heiji`s Code of Love (Part 1)
Conan et Heiji, le code de l`amour (1re partie)
Conan to Heiji: Koi no Angou (Zenpen)
episode.summary: On a rainy day, Conan bumps into a suspicious man being purused by police. The man is a drug dealer, and he drops his notebook as he flees. The notebook contains a code written using subway station and line numbers, but some of the code washed away in the rain. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 加賀百万石ミステリーツアー (加賀温泉編)
Kaga Hyakumangoku Mystery Tour (Kaga Hot Springs Arc)
Kaga Hyakumangoku Mystery Tour. 2e partie : les bains de Kaga
Kaga Hyakuman Ishi Mystery Tour (Kaga Onsen Hen)
episode.summary: Ran accompanies Akiyama to the hospital after she is attacked while Kogoro and the others continue visiting the checkpoints. After arriving at the Kanazawa 21st Century Museum, Conan chckes the four cards that fell out of Akiyama`s bag. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 加賀百万石ミステリーツアー (金沢編)
Kaga Hyakumangoku Mystery Tour (Kanazawa Arc)
Kaga Hyakumangoku Mystery Tour 1re partie : Kanazawa
Kaga Hyakuman Ishi Mystery Tour (Kanazawa Hen)
episode.summary: Conan, Kogoro, and Ran arrive in Ishikawa Prefecture`s Kanazawa and are met by tourism agency employees Yuzo Tanimoto and Moeko Miyazawa and event company president Yuya Tadokoro and his employees Osamu Kuranishi and Harumi Akiyama. They have asked for Kogoro`s help with the Kaga Hyakumangoku Mystery Tour city revitalization event to be held in the Kanazawa. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 堤無津川凧揚げ事件 (後編)
Teimuzu River Kite Flying Case (Part 2)
Le tournoi de cerfs-volants de la Tamizu (2e partie)
Teimuzugawa Takoage Jiken (Kouhen)
episode.summary: Renno is led between two posts without a rope barrier and falls into the river. Yatsukoshi, who had feelings for Renno`s mistress, Kakura, whose younger sister had her emotions toyed with, and Takami, whose husband cheated on her, all had motives. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 堤無津川凧揚げ事件 (前編)
Teimuzu River Kite Flying Case (Part 1)
Le tournoi de cerfs-volants de la Tamizu (1re partie)
Teimuzugawa Takoage Jiken (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Conan, Genta, and Mitsuhiko enter the Teimuzu River Kite Flying Event. Renno and Yatsukoshi form the opposing team. Yatsukoshi holds the kite string while Renno holds their kite and speaks on the phone with his wife Takami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 面倒な救急患者
The Troublesome Emergency Patient
Un blessé encombrant
Mendou na Kyuukyuukanja
episode.summary: While Conan and his friends are on their way home from school, a man being chased by the police grabs Ayumi and uses her as a shield. Later, the man passes out from an injury on the back of his head. Emergency medical doctor Kido and nurse Natsumi treat the man, but he remains unconscious and in serious condition. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灰原哀監禁事件
Haibara Ai Imprisonment Case
La séquestration d’Ai Haibara
Haibara Ai Kankin Jiken
episode.summary: Conan and his friends search for Ai, who disappeared on her way home from shopping. She is bound and imprisoned by a robber inside the home of her recent acquaintance Higaki Mitsuru along with Mitsuru herself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 吹雪に消えた恋人
The Lover Gone Missing in a Snowstorm
Cherche fiancé dans tempête de neige
Fubuki ni Kieta Koibito
episode.summary: Conan, Agasa, and the kids visit a boarding house where they are greeted by Ryoko, Aya, and Juri, the three sisters who manage the building. Conan happens upon Aya and Juri`s boyfriend Masahiko arguing. Aya is strongly opposed to Juri`s relationship with Masahiko, who is known for being a bad boy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 工藤新一水族館事件 (後編)
Kudo Shinichi Aquarium Case (Part 2)
Shinichi Kudô à l’aquarium (2e partie)
Kudou Shin`ichi Suizokukan Jiken (Kouhen)
episode.summary: While Shinichi and Ran are on a date at the Beika Aquarium, Shumoto is stabbed to death. Shinichi and Inspector Megure question Naho, Kanoko, and Jinbe, the people Shumoto was communicating with using his phone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 工藤新一水族館事件 (前編)
Kudo Shinichi Aquarium Case (Part 1)
Shinichi Kudô à l’aquarium (1re partie)
Kudou Shin`ichi Suizokukan Jiken (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Conan and Ran go to the Beika Aquarium where Ran and Shinichi once went on a date. During their date, a man was stabbed to death. The knife used in the stabbing was modified to prevent the victim`s blood from getting on the culprit. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギスギスしたお茶会 (後編)
The Tense Tea Party (Part 2)
Un thé sous haute tension (2e partie)
Gisugisu Shita Ochakai (Kouhen)
episode.summary: The police fail to find the container used to hold the poison that killed Reina in the hospital room, and Megure believes it`s likely the culprit took it outside to dispose of it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギスギスしたお茶会 (前編)
The Tense Tea Party (Part 1)
Un thé sous haute tension (1re partie)
Gisugisu Shita Ochakai (Zenpen)
episode.summary: A visitor named Reina is killed at Haido Central Hospital. The cause of death is asphyxiation caused by cyanide. Inspector Megure suspects hospital patient Juri and visitors Katsuki and Tokie, who were drinking tea with the victim. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あやつられた名探偵 (後編)
The Manipulated Great Detective (Part 2)
Le grand détective manipulé (2e partie)
Ayatsurareta Meitantei (Kouhen)
episode.summary: Conan and Kogoro are taken to a warehouse by the gang of thieves to wait for their boss Mr. Head. Suddenly Head`s metallic altered voice comes over the speakers. Kogoro looks at his watch and panics when he sees the time is 2:30 in the morning. If he doesn`t determine who killed Head`s son by dawn, Ran will be killed by an assassin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あやつられた名探偵 (前編)
The Manipulated Great Detective (Part 1)
Le grand détective manipulé (1re partie)
Ayatsurareta Meitantei (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Inspector Megure asks Kogoro for help disguising himself as a famous safecracker and infiltrating a gang of thieves. However, the gang boss Mr. Head sees through his disguise. The man who killed Head`s son is among his subordinates, and he instructs Kogoro to work with the gang as planned to determine the killer`s identity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えたムンクの叫び
Munch`s Missing Scream
Le Cri de Munch a disparu !
Kieta Munch no Sakebi
episode.summary: An exhibition of Munch`s work is being held at the Suzuki Museum. Munch`s "Despair" and "Anxiety" are delivered to Narita Airport and packed by shipping company president Shimamura and his employees. Later, the truck transporting "Despair" and "Anxiety" depart for the Suzuki Museum, with the limousine carrying Conan, Ran, and Jirokichi following close behind. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 緋色の追求
The Scarlet Pursuit
La poursuite écarlate
Hiiro no Tsuikyuu
episode.summary: Elementary school teacher Natsuko is struck while working at school and pushed off the stairs in front of the park. Conan and his companions question Sugamoto, another teacher who had planned to walk her home, and parents Ueno and Kandachi, who had appointments to meet with Natsuko. Conan notices something strange while listening to their stories. Later, the police review a photo of the answer sheets Natsuko was grading. Jodie and Camel fail to discover any information that could help them solve the crime from the photo, but Amuro and Conan realize who the culprit is after seeing the picture. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 緋色の序章
The Scarlet Prologue
Prologue écarlate
Hiiro no Jishou
episode.summary: Amuro witnesses a woman pushed from the top of the stairs at Haido Park. However, he doesn`t see the culprit`s face. The unconscious and gravely injured woman pushed from the stairs is Jodie`s friend and Haido Elementary School teacher Natsuko. Conan and Jodie head to the park and determine Natsuko was attacked somewhere else, and it soon becomes clear she was assaulted at the school. Later, Megure and the police question her coworker Sugamoto, who tried to give Natsuko a ride home, and Ueno and Kandachi, parents of students with appointments to see Natsuko... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天使が消えた蜃気楼
Mirage of the Disappearing Angel
Le mirage de l`ange disparu
Tenshi ga Kieta Shinkirou
episode.summary: Kogoro is hired to find the missing painter Aoki by his wife. Conan determines Aoki is in Tokugawa Prefecture`s Uozo from the painting Aoki sent his wife Midori. Kogoro, Conan, Ran, and Midori discover Aoki`s drowned corpse in Uozu. They investigate the inn where Aoki was staying and interview the manager Hayashi. When Conan sees the painting in the photo, he noticies something was added. The data from the day Aoki took the photo had been erased from his digital camera. Later, permanent part-timer Akagi, traveler Shirakawa, and fisherman Ishiguro all emerge as suspects... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 少年探偵団VS老人[シルバー]探偵団
The Detective Boys vs the Silver Detectives
Detective Boys vs Silver Detectives
Shounen Tanteidan vs Silver Tanteidan
episode.summary: Conan, Ayumi, Genta, and Mitsuhiko meet the Silver Detectives Tokunaga, Mutsuhiko, Ginta, and Yasuko who find a stolen bicycle. The next day, a young man named Kuroda is found dead in his home. The Silver Detectives are the first to discover the body. While pursuing a hooligan they caught littering, they chased him into the house where they found the body. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 織り姫クラブへようこそ
Welcome to Club Orihime
Bienvenue au Club di Vega !
Orihime Club e Youkoso
episode.summary: Sonoko`s acquaintance Chikada Eimi has her hair cut by someone at high school. Three days earlier and the day before, other students were the victims similar incidents. Before the incidents, warning letters were left in the box of Club Orihime, the romantic help desk Eimi and her friends set up at the school. This morning they received a letter stating, "EC will be brought to justice!" The letters are the initials of the victim. At the scene of the crime, they find a new letter stating, "TB dies as sundown tonight!" Only two hours remain until sunset. To prevent another incident from occurring, Conan and his friends search for a student with the initials TB... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 緋色の真相
The Scarlet Truth
La vérité écarlate
Hiiro no Shinsou
episode.summary: Akai suddenly appears in the back seat of Jodie`s car and fires at the secret police`s vehicles. The bullet strikes a tire, and the FBI agents successfully shake off the secret police. Meanwhile, at the Kudo family home Amuro`s subordinates inform him Akai shot out a tire, causing their cars to crash. Later, Jodie`s car returns to the crash site. Akai takes a cell phone from the secret police and begins speaking to Amuro (Bourbon). He tells him it was a mistake to let Conan know he had the nickname Zero. Akai knew who Amuro truly was... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 緋色の帰還
The Scarlet Return
Retour écarlate
Hiiro no Kikan
episode.summary: Amuro visits Okiya at the Edo family home and begins explaining how one corpse was swapped out for another. Akai was shot in the head and burned along with his car at Raiha Pass. However, Amuro believes Akai switched his own body out for Kusuda`s and is in fact still alive. Amuro explains Akai`s trick step by step to Okiya. Meanwhile, Jodie was thinking the same thing as Amuro. Amuro reasons the body swap was planned not by Akai but by Conan. Amuro then asks Okiya to remove his mask. He is certain Okiya is Akai, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 緋色の交錯
The Scarlet Intersection
Chevauchement écarlate
Hiiro no Kousaku
episode.summary: When Conan hears Camel`s story, he realizes Vermouth disguised herself as Jodie and spoke with him. Conan is frustrated the he acted just as Bourbon (Amuro) and Vermouth planned. Amuro meets with Vermouth, who is still disguised as Jodie. She informs him she learned from Camel that Kusuda shot himself. Amuro responds that there was another burned man who was shot in the head when Kusuda disappeared with thoughts of FBI agent Akai Shuichi on his mind. Amuro deduces Akai is still alive, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真夏のプールに沈む謎 (後編)
The Mystery Sinking in the Midsummer Pool (Part 2)
Mystère estival au fond d`une piscine (2de partie)
Manatsu no Pool ni Shizumu Nazo (Kouhen)
episode.summary: Nagami`s body is discovered in the hotel pool. Megure questions Samaki, Hamaka, and Toyoshima regarding the actions they took after they left Nagami alone in the pool. According to the pool reception staff, between the presumed hour of Nagami`s death between noon and 1 PM, Toyoshima, Samaki, and Hamaka each came to the pool in that order. Later, the bellboys describe the situation at the pool while they were searching for Nagami, leading Conan and Sera to investigate the pool and discover which of her three acquaintances murdered her. They reproduce the manner in which the body disappeared in an experiment, bringing them closer to the culprit... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真夏のプールに沈む謎 (前編)
The Mystery Sinking in the Midsummer Pool (Part 1)
Mystère estival au fond d`une piscine (1re partie)
Manatsu no Pool ni Shizumu Nazo (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Conan and his friends go to a hotel pool where Nagami, daughter of the president of Oiso Finance, drowns to death. She had been wearing a diving tank and searching the pool for her lost necklace. Based on the crime scene, Inspector Megure believes it may have been an accident. However, the hotel bellboys claim the body in the pool suddenly appeared. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太閤恋する名人戦 (後編)
Taiko Meijin`s Match of Love (Part 2)
Match pour le titre d`un Taikô amoureux (2de partie)
Taikou Koi Suru Meijinsen (Kouhen)
episode.summary: During his Meijin title match, Haneda Shukichi receives a threatening letter from a man calling himself the Headless Shogi Player who claims to have kidnapped his girlfriend Yumi. Conan solves the second game`s code and arrives at a grave on Yureizaka. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太閤恋する名人戦 (前編)
Taiko Meijin`s Match of Love (Part 1)
Match pour le titre d`un Taikô amoureux (1re partie)
Taikou Koi Suru Meijinsen (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Haneda Shukichi, also known as Taiko Meijin, takes on Katsumata Chikara in a meijin title match in Yamanashi Prefecture. Just before the second day`s match begins, Shukichi receives a threatening letter from a man calling himself the Headless Shogi Player who claims to have kidnapped Shukichi`s girlfriend Miyamoto Yumi. In order to save Yumi, Shukichi announces he needs time to think and takes a taxi to Tokyo. Interpreting the code labelled "first game," Shukichi arrives at Meiji Jingu where he runs into Conan and his friends as they visit power spots. The code pointed to Kato Kiyomasa`s well. After hearing about the situation, Conan searches the area around the well and discovers the second game`s code left behind by the culprit... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三人の第一発見者 (前編)
Three First Discoverers (Part 1)
Les trois premiers sur les lieux (1re partie)
Sannin no Daiichi Hakkensha (Zenpen)
episode.summary: Conan and his friends notice a young boy looking at an apartment from an alleyway and call out to him. The woman who lives in the apartment asked the boy to call the police if she didn`t exit her room after three men came and left her apartment, as it would mean she was likely dead. Conan and his friends discover scriptwriter Yasue dead from hanging in the room. Based on the situation, Megure determines it was a murder. However, the men Shibakaru, Sakaba, and Habanaka who visited the room all claim she was already dead when they came to the room. The case has three first discoverers... Source: crunchyroll
